title: Verify report: excel detects comas in csv as delimiter, whereas semi-colon should be used
body:
Issue #422 should be tackled before this one.

***

In excel, when opening a csv as outputted by verify_segmentation.py, here's what happens:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34774759/206494046-19a47bdd-e14f-4200-b9fd-1a3ab787ea31.png)

Coma's are automatically detected as delimiters, whereas the semi-colon is the delimiter.

The workaround was to open csv in a text editor, then copy/paste the content into excel, then convert this pasted text to columns by indicating the ";" as delimiter. I'd be nice to be able to open the csv directly with excel.

Solution:
- replace the comas in raster's metadata by ";"
- use coma as delimiter when saving csv.

This has been tested and works:

Before (notice how raster metadata is interpreted as columns):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34774759/206496579-4295fc8a-eaf8-46c6-b458-7619d8cac80f.png)

After (raster's metadata remains in a single column):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34774759/206496398-a560c277-b579-4d6c-b8bd-f9dcd2760fd8.png)

Example csv:
[report_info_buil_148_subset_v3_20221117-121504.csv](https://github.com/NRCan/geo-deep-learning/files/10187353/report_info_buil_148_subset_v3_20221117-121504.csv)
